quest.name: Restricted Reading
journal: Montichaigne is waiting to offer you further instructions.
objectives: Speak with the index page while Y'shtola is accompanying you.
Search for House Daemir's research notes.
Hand the Epiphanies of House Daemir to Y'shtola.
Speak with Nidhana at the Great Work.
Inspect the astrally dense pocket of water.
Deliver the flask of astral-aspected water to Y'shtola.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I'd like to set out as soon as you're ready.

dialogue.name: MONTICHAIGNE
dialogue.text: You'll be heading directly to the archives from here, I presume?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: You presume correctly.

dialogue.name: MONTICHAIGNE
dialogue.text: Then you'll want to speak with the index page when you arrive. It's been instructed to grant you access to the restricted section.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Excellent. Once again, we thank you for all your help.

dialogue.name: MONTICHAIGNE
dialogue.text: Oh, it was my pleasure, believe me. May you find the knowledge you seek!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Shall we?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Y'shtola is now accompanying you. Keep her at your side in order to proceed with quest objectives.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You can leave Y'shtola behind by entering a different area, or by speaking with her and selecting the option to part ways.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: If you wish to have Y'shtola accompany you again, return and speak with her at the original location.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: To think the set of instructions I laughingly imagined may actually exist but yalms away from where you found me napping...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If I had known of Alzadaal III's exploits sooner, I could well have saved myself days of research. Even a children's book might have pointed me in the right direction.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: To achieve the impossible, one must needs be flexible of mind and look beyond conventional wisdom. A lesson I had already learned, but clearly not taken to heart.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Talk.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Part ways.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Discuss Noumenon.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Come along, Forename. Noumenon and its forbidden wisdom awaits.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Are you sure you wish to part ways with Y'shtola?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Very well, but please do hurry back. I shall await you at the annex.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: All set this time? No forgotten chores or errands to call you away? Good─the forbidden tomes await!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You must be accompanied by Y'shtola and have her at your side in order to proceed with quest objectives.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Y'shtola has yet to arrive. Be sure she is at your side before attempting to continue.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Enter the restricted archives?

dialogue.name: GUIDE04533
dialogue.text: No SmOkInG! nO tHrOwInG bOoKs! AnD nO yElLiNg OuT “eUrEkA!” iN aN oBnOxIoUsLy LoUd VoIcE!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: So many books I've yet to read...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Yes, yes, we are here for one specific volume. You needn't remind me.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: (-Untitled Goldsmith's Journal-)Today, in a world not my own, I met the most beautiful voidborn creature. She was so unlike her ravenous brethren. Eyes blazing not with hunger, but trembling─like a candle's flame, threatening to flicker out at any moment.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: (-Untitled Goldsmith's Journal-)I wonder if “she” is even the proper word. Such distinctions seem inconsequential. Insignificant, even.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: (-Untitled Goldsmith's Journal-)All that matters is the love I feel for this exquisite, transcendent being!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Though you are tempted to read more, this does not seem to be the volume you are seeking...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: (-Primal Disquisitions-)In the year 1564 of the Sixth Astral Era, the Amalj'aa summoned Ifrit, their patron god. Accounts describe the being as a gigantic, lizard-like being with a potent command of fire-aspected magicks.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: (-Primal Disquisitions-)If we consider that primal summoning is an act fueled by faith and prayer, it is unsurprising, if not expected, that the resulting deiform entity should manifest the appearance and powers with which it is attributed by its worshipers.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: (-Primal Disquisitions-)What, then, might emerge from the aether should one who believes in an almighty omniscience attempt the same ritual? Would the Scholar Himself grace us with His presence? Some other embodiment of divine sagacity?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: (-Primal Disquisitions-)Could this man-made god truly be all-knowing? And if it were, whence would such knowledge arise?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: (-Primal Disquisitions-)I myself have many questions concerning the nature of the ancient world. With no spell to transport me back to the days of old, could I instead summon a being possessed of encyclopedic wisdom of every age? Yet with no means to verify its pronouncements, how could one be certain they were true?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Though your mind spins with the possibilities discussed therein, this does not seem to be the volume you are seeking...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: (-Epiphanies of House Daemir-)The following pages detail an advanced method for manipulating rift-spanning apertures as devised by Nuhashahn, the ninth patriarch of House Daemir.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: (-Epiphanies of House Daemir-)We present these research notes to the faculty of Sharlayan's Studium as both a token of our friendship and an expression of our boundless admiration.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You appear to have located the forbidden volume you seek. Y'shtola will need to make the final confirmation...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Have something you'd like to show me, do you? My apologies─I flipped open but a single book and was completely absorbed by the contents...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Well done, Forename. I think you may have found our prize.

dialogue.name: GUIDE04533
dialogue.text: CoNgRaTuLaTiOnS oN lOcAtInG tHe ObJeCt Of YoUr SeArCh. PlEaSe MoVe AlOnG.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: As much as I would love to start crafting the Atomos, I'm afraid this is far outside my field of expertise.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Fortunately, we know a Hannish alchemist who would be delighted to involve herself in our House Daemir project.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Our business here is concluded, for the moment. Please pass on our regards to the Forum.

dialogue.name: GUIDE04533
dialogue.text: YoUr MeSsAgE wIlL bE cOnVeYeD. sHoUlD yOu WiSh To InDuLgE iN mOrE fOrBiDdEn LiTeRaTuRe, I wIlL bE hErE. pAtRoN mOdE dIsAbLeD. sEcUrItY mOdE eNgAgEd.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If anyone can help us, Nidhana can. I say we return to Thavnair and look for her at the Great Work.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: All these sallow, sleep-deprived faces, but their eyes still burn with fiery zeal. Some things never change.

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: Y'shtola tells me you are pursuing a most fascinating study! And that you want me to be a part of it.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I have no doubt you will be interested. This research log should speak for itself.

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: Will it now...?

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: By the Sisters! This is the mark of House Daemir! I never even knew such a work existed...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Few should. It was sequestered in Noumenon's restricted archives, after all.

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: It was!? But...that means every word within is forbidden knowledge!

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: A forbidden tome filled with forbidden research, and you put it right into my unsuspecting hand!?

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: I can hardly wait to read it!

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: To think the Daemir were developing such marvelous techniques so long ago. How many innovations have been lost over the centuries, I wonder...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Now that you've glanced over the notes, what say you to helping us build a new mock Atomos?

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: I say yes! A thousand times yes!

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: Work on a Daemir project that had even the redoubtable scholars of Sharlayan trembling in their sandals? No alchemist of the Great Work could resist!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: You are a woman after my own heart.

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: Oh, I suppose I should ask: what do you mean to do with this big-mouthed simulacrum once we've built it?

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: So, there's a secret voidgate...and it's sealed in the ruins at the bottom of the Bounty? Today is a day of revelations indeed.

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: If the purpose of our man-made Atomos is to expand this hidden portal, then I will need to see it for myself, I think. Manipulating rift-spanning apertures is not the sort of thing you want to attempt without first taking into account every single factor.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Then by all means, accompany us to the vault. I plan to lead us back there shortly...once we've finished gathering the components I require.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Sharlayan's markets provided the raw aquamarine and pure water crystals...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: But I might need help obtaining a small quantity of astrally infused water.

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: For such a liquid, you need go no further than the Font of Maya─the ascetics of old once favored the place for their meditations, and the water which pools there now is known to enliven the flow of aether.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: That sounds perfect. If you would be so kind as to fill a flask at the pool, I will petition Vrtra to join us. The idea I have in mind won't amount to much without his authority to command the voidgate.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Shall we be about it, then? We meet back here anon.

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: Ah, there is no greater joy than having a new puzzle to ponder...

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Archon Y'shtola requested that I join you, but of her plans she offered scant detail...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: The boy Mehrahd was glad to hear the news of the foundation. It means a new life for him and his sister.

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: Oh, I forgot to mention! The Font of Maya attracts aggressive wildlife, and you should watch out for them when, uh...you go there next time. My apologies.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Do you have that flask for me?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Yes...this should suffice. Thank you, Forename.
